intro: Hebea dodii, commonly known as the African hebe, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, elliptical leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Hebea dodii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
